name: Durango Riverside Resort

reviews.text: Was looking for an RV park in or around Durango, Colorado ... decided on this one because of its location north of Durango (cooler weather) and along the Animas River. Made the reservation over the phone and gave the lady all of my pertinent information (arrival and departure, trailer size, slide-outs, etc.).
reviews.title: Nice Setting ... Staff Needs Customer Service Training
Durango River Resort -- isolocated location - staff not friendly
reviews.text: Upon our arrival, we were greeted by a young man about 18 years of age. He asked me to come inside the office to register. When I did, I was greeted by a young woman, also seemingly 18 years of age. The check-in process was fine. However, neither offered any information about the park, the location or hours of any of the amenities (showers, store, pool, movie nights, etc.). I had to ask, to which I was given a couple of loose pieces of paper and told that all of the information was on them.

description: Shaded by towering pines, this San Juan Mountains campground nestles against the Animas River 12 miles north of Durango. Many of the campsites and cabins lie just steps from the broad, rock-bottom river popular with anglers and kayakers. For breathtaking alpine scenery, take a day trip on the steam-powered Durango & Silverton Narrow Gauge Railroad or drive the 232-mile San Juan Skyway Scenic Byway. This campground features a large pool, game room, basketball court, pet area and lots of fun for kids. At sunset, grab a sundae at the ice cream parlor or a cup of coffee at the espresso shop, then head for the outdoor movie theater. The café serves breakfast and dinner.
